source.3908500f:
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
import missingno as msno


from wordcloud import WordCloud # wordcloud


import plotly.offline as py
from plotly.offline import init_notebook_mode, iplot
init_notebook_mode(connected = True)
import plotly.graph_objs as go

 
import requests
from PIL import Image
from io import BytesIO

import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

sns.set_style('darkgrid')
source.39d4aef8:
#printing images from URL
fig, ax = plt.subplots(10,10, figsize=(15,15))
for i in range(100):                         # iterating 100 rows only from dataset 
    r = requests.get(df['Photo'][i])    # data is dataframe with "Photo" column 
    im = Image.open(BytesIO(r.content))     # opening the images 
    ax[i//10][i%10].imshow(im)
    ax[i//10][i%10].axis('off') # indexes of the images will not show 
plt.show()

source.a234d7c7:
fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(16,32))# plotting two subplots 
wordcloud = WordCloud(background_color='white',width=800, height=800).generate(' '.join(df['Club'].dropna().astype(str)) )
wordcloud_sub = WordCloud(background_color='white',width=800, height=800).generate(' '.join(df['Nationality'].dropna().astype(str)) ) # used astype(str)bbecause data is not present as str
ax[0].imshow(wordcloud)
ax[0].axis('off')
ax[0].set_title('Club Name')
ax[1].imshow(wordcloud_sub)
ax[1].axis('off')
ax[1].set_title("Player's Nationality")
plt.show()

pr_cols=['Crossing', 'Finishing', 'HeadingAccuracy', 'ShortPassing', 'Volleys',
       'Dribbling', 'Curve', 'FKAccuracy', 'LongPassing', 'BallControl',
       'Acceleration', 'SprintSpeed', 'Agility', 'Reactions', 'Balance',
       'ShotPower', 'Jumping', 'Stamina', 'Strength', 'LongShots',
       'Aggression', 'Interceptions', 'Positioning', 'Vision', 'Penalties',
       'Composure', 'Marking', 'StandingTackle', 'SlidingTackle', 'GKDiving',
       'GKHandling', 'GKKicking', 'GKPositioning', 'GKReflexes']
for i in range(len(pr_cols)):
    print('Best {0} : {1}'.format(pr_cols[i],df.loc[df[pr_cols[i]].idxmax()][1]))
source.cc08aa52:
rating = pd.DataFrame(df.groupby(['Nationality'])['Overall'].sum().reset_index())
count = pd.DataFrame(rating.groupby('Nationality')['Overall'].sum().reset_index())

trace = [go.Choropleth(
            colorscale = 'Blues',
            colorbar_title ="Overall_Rating",
            locationmode = 'country names',
            locations = count['Nationality'],
            text = count['Nationality'],
            z = count['Overall'],
)]

layout = go.Layout(title = 'Country vs Ratings')

fig = go.Figure(data = trace, layout = layout)
py.iplot(fig)

source.331d302d:
# Compare six clubs in relation to age
some_clubs = ('Juventus', 'Real Madrid', 'Paris Saint-Germain', 'FC Barcelona', 'Legia Warszawa', 'Manchester United')
df_club = df.loc[df['Club'].isin(some_clubs) & df['Age']]
fig, ax = plt.subplots()
fig.set_size_inches(15, 8)
ax = sns.violinplot(x="Club", y="Age", data=df_club);
ax.set_title(label='Distribution of age in some clubs', fontsize=20);
source.932ab000:
# The longest membership in the club
import datetime
now = datetime.datetime.now()
df['Join_year'] = df.Joined.dropna().map(lambda x: x.split(',')[1].split(' ')[1])
df['Years_of_member'] = (df.Join_year.dropna().map(lambda x: now.year - int(x))).astype('int').dropna()
membership = df[['Name', 'Club', 'Years_of_member','Join_year']].sort_values(by = 'Years_of_member', ascending = False).dropna().head()
membership.set_index('Name', inplace=True)
membership
source.8daac5bb:
# filling missing values with mode and median of the dataset 

df['ShortPassing'].fillna(df['ShortPassing'].mean(), inplace = True)
df['Volleys'].fillna(df['Volleys'].mean(), inplace = True)
df['Dribbling'].fillna(df['Dribbling'].mean(), inplace = True)
df['Curve'].fillna(df['Curve'].mean(), inplace = True)
df['FKAccuracy'].fillna(df['FKAccuracy'], inplace = True)
df['LongPassing'].fillna(df['LongPassing'].mean(), inplace = True)
df['BallControl'].fillna(df['BallControl'].mean(), inplace = True)
df['HeadingAccuracy'].fillna(df['HeadingAccuracy'].mean(), inplace = True)
df['Finishing'].fillna(df['Finishing'].mean(), inplace = True)
df['Crossing'].fillna(df['Crossing'].mean(), inplace = True)
df['Weight'].fillna('200lbs', inplace = True)
df['Contract Valid Until'].fillna(2019, inplace = True)
df['Height'].fillna("5'11", inplace = True)
df['Loaned From'].fillna('None', inplace = True)
df['Joined'].fillna('Jul 1, 2018', inplace = True)
df['Jersey Number'].fillna(8, inplace = True)
df['Body Type'].fillna('Normal', inplace = True)
df['Position'].fillna('ST', inplace = True)
df['Club'].fillna('No Club', inplace = True)
df['Work Rate'].fillna('Medium/ Medium', inplace = True)
df['Skill Moves'].fillna(df['Skill Moves'].median(), inplace = True)
df['Weak Foot'].fillna(3, inplace = True)
df['Preferred Foot'].fillna('Right', inplace = True)
df['International Reputation'].fillna(1, inplace = True)
df['Wage'].fillna('€200K', inplace = True)

source.2a254aed:
**Introduction**


From Wikipedia:
FIFA 19 is a football simulation video game developed by EA Vancouver as part of Electronic Arts’ FIFA series. Announced on 6 June 2018 for its E3 2018 press conference, it was released on 28 September 2018 for PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, Xbox 360, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch, and Microsoft Windows. It is the 26th installment in the FIFA series. As with FIFA 18, Cristiano Ronaldo appears as the cover athlete of the regular edition. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_19
